snippet: Phones like Samsung's new Galaxy S3 can shoot high-definition video, which looks great but quickly fills up a smartphone's memory. Dropbox, which sells online storage, is figuring out ways to make itself part of their business. To accelerate the...
abstract: Phones like Samsung's new Galaxy S3 can shoot high-definition video, which looks great but quickly fills up a smartphone's memory. Dropbox, which sells online storage, is figuring out ways to make itself part of their business. To accelerate the business, Dropbox is doubling its storage volumes without raising prices.

headline.main: Dropbox Meets a Smartphone Video Explosion
